thread.title: Report: Celtics focused on Jimmy Butler amid Cousins trade news
thread.title_full: Report: Celtics focused on Jimmy Butler amid Cousins trade news

title: Report: Celtics focused on Jimmy Butler amid Cousins trade news
text:
Tweet The Celtics reportedly continue to set their sights on Jimmy Butler. Joe Camporeale-USA TODAY Sports 
The Boston Celtics, given the Sunday’s NBA blockbuster, appear to be sitting on the sideline at the moment. 
The New Orleans Pelicans reportedly acquired DeMarcus Cousins from the Sacramento Kings late Sunday night for a price that certainly didn’t seem very steep at all. New Orleans sent back a package that included 2016 first-round selection Buddy Hield, a 2017 first-round pick and a 2017 second-rounder (via Philadelphia) to the Kings in exchange for the All-Star big man. 
That seems like a very doable price for a team like the Celtics, who still have a surplus of very valuable trade chips, with the ability to swap first-round picks with the Brooklyn Nets in 2017 and Brooklyn’s first-round pick in 2018. However, the Celtics never seemed to get close to acquiring Boogie, and it sounds like they have their sights set on something else. 
Longtime NBA reporter Ric Bucher reported early Monday morning that the Celtics are preoccupied with finding a trade for Chicago Bulls star Jimmy Butler. 
Source w/reasons Pels got Boogie: Cs (too focussed on getting Butler), Orl (could've had him, balked) & Phx (Sac didn't want BKnight). 
— Ric Bucher (@RicBucher) February 20, 2017 
This certainly isn’t the first time the Celtics have been tied to Butler , and it’s unlikely those rumors die down anytime soon, at least not before Thursday’s NBA trade deadline. 
This article first appeared on NESN.com and was syndicated with permission.
